comments:
Using build I200402190800.

I was just trying to rename a class in a package from Package Explorer. It was 
a self-hosting worspace (ie. running eclipse from eclipse in Debug session).

I made several rename before this failure without any problems...

Here's the error message:
Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".

I will attach the stack trace...

Created an attachment (id=8156)
Exception stack trace

It seems to happen when I try to open Refactor->Rename... dialog on a class 
which has compiler error(s)...

I modify a valid class and introduce an compiler error and save my modification.
I'm not in auto build and does not build my workspace... Then I try to refactor 
this class and got this problem...
Seems more a JDT-UI problem than Platform one...

stack trace point to the java editor:

Error Feb 25, 2004 13:07:06.886 Problems occurred when invoking code from
plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Group not found: group.editor
at
org.eclipse.jface.action.ContributionManager.addToGroup(ContributionManager.java:113)
at
org.eclipse.jface.action.ContributionManager.prependToGroup(ContributionManager.java:337)
at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorActionBars.getToolBarManager(EditorActionBars.java:254)
at
org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorActionBarContributor.init(EditorActionBarContributor.java:154)
at
org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorActionBarContributor.init(EditorActionBarContributor.java:133)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.BasicJavaEditorActionContributor.init(BasicJavaEditorActionContributor.java:131)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.BasicEditorActionContributor.init(BasicEditorActionContributor.java:108)
at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.createEditorActionBars(EditorManager.java:228)

>Seems more a JDT-UI problem than Platform one...
What makes you think so? Can you explain. I tend to disagree since the ID is
defined in Platform UI land and there the call addToGroup() is made with that ID.

This build was broken due to a miscommunication surrounding our build 
submission.  Please reset your perspective, and try to duplicate.  If you can 
duplicate, then please re-open.  Otherwise, I'm closing this as a duplicate of 
Bug 52549.
